This report is  of interest to those seeking more assistance in the digital forensics. It is suggested that in some jurisdictions, the use of digital forensics equipment could be undertaken to provide a better understand of their legal processes.

Further information about the report

The report was also released earlier this year by the Digital forensics Laboratory. The report was released a few days ago and was then available to those working for it in the digital forensics analyst’s office.


A new Internet Explorer vulnerability has been present in a Windows Internet Explorer object.

A vulnerability exists in the Microsoft object.
The vulnerability allows remote code execution (RCE) of a user’s computer to the point where Internet Explorer could be loaded.

However, it is not likely that this vulnerability is being used in attacks against a Windows user, which might cause them to run unauthorised code (e.g. a shellcode that is the most common exploit).

The vulnerability appears to be connected to the MS09-014 bug that is present in the Windows Explorer object (Windows 98), MS09-002, MS09-001, MS09-002 and MS09-001).

Adobe Reader, Adobe Acrobat Reader and Adobe Reader are not affected.
